skillTree.localised_description: The palanquins of Nurgle are ornate thrones decorated in mouldering finery and decaying cushions.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

Daemonic units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is low.
	
	Daemonic units also have:
	Physical Resistance
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: A colossal Daemon-insect, whose appearance is so repugnant it leaves festering scars upon the mind.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can fly.

skillTree.localised_description: The Fly Lord and his devotees despise Tzeentch, for his obsession with schemes and trickery are the polar opposite of Nurgle's delight in slow, musty stagnation.

effects.description: Melee attack: +10 when fighting against Tzeentchian factions
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Tzeentchian factions

skillTree.localised_description: Anything fired at this vile Nurglish servant's immense girth must penetrate many folds of sweaty fat before they even have the slightest chance of piercing his flesh.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say noâ€¦

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs single and multiple units

skillTree.localised_description: Pestilent glory.
The unwholesome, decrepit warriors of Nurgle stand bolstered among the united forces of Chaos.
The Warriors of Chaos are the playthings of Gods and given many gifts, including formidable fighting skills.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, itâ€™s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.

attributes.bullet_text: When attacking braced charge defenders, this unit only loses half of its charge bonus.

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve: +1 per turn
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +100
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Imagine a rubbery, pus-filled bag lurching towards you. Now imagine it is travelling at twice its usual speed...

skillTree.localised_description: Sulphurous, acerbic disease is no respecter of rank, nobility or prowess in battle; all shall fall afore Nurgle's filthy infections.

ui_effects.localised_text: Will spread to enemies within the Spread Range metres of affected unit

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!
Just as all life is born, so it must wither and die. Before that happens comes disease, in all its disgusting, filth-ridden glory.
With the servants of Chaos comes the corruption â€“ as the landscape twists, this one speeds the transformation.

effects.description:
All other types of corruption: -1
	(local province)

All other types of corruption: -2
	(local province)

All other types of corruption: -3
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: This willing servant of the Ruinous Powers has a resilience that is beyond any mortal measure.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: To despoil, to corrupt and ruin, to break the mortals and take their gods from them - this is what Chaos wants.
Battles can be lost, but can the war ever really be won? The advance of Ruin can never truly be halted once and for all.

	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Uncleanliness is next to Godliness.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: From which species this one comes is very much open to question, so distorted have their features become through Grandfather Nurgle's loving caresses.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: What this one doesn't know about plagues, diseases, contagions, maladies, infections and epidemics simply isn't worth knowing.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This nasty little concoction came from no one knows quite whence to spread the vilest pestilence, horrific, weeping buboes, and a terrifying, screaming death to all across the land.

This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Myriad open sores weep with festering, foetid pus, enabling Neiglen's foul plagues to infect quickly and spread faster than before.
